snippet: Russian authorities, determined that nothing will mar the Olympics in Sochi, have been accused of human rights violations.
abstract: Makhachkala Journal; 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia, are still four months away, but residents of Dagestan's capital city Makhachkala say they have been feeling effects for months; human rights activists say Russian authorities, determined not to have the festivities marred by a terrorist attack, are clamping down on seething North Caucasus region, which lies uncomfortably close to the Olympic city, picking up people suspected of being militants and detaining them without charges.
lead_paragraph: Russian authorities, determined that nothing will mar the Olympics in Sochi, have been accused of human rights violations.

headline.main: A Russian Region Neither at War Nor at Peace, but Facing a Crackdown
headline.print_headline: A Russian Region Neither at War Nor at Peace, but Facing a Crackdown

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
